alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 18 at 3:49AM HST until October 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .The first large northwest to north-northwest swell (320-330 degrees) of the season peaked overnight, which is generating surf above warning levels for exposed north and west facing shores of the smaller islands and to the advisory level for west facing shores of the Big Island. Expect this to hold today, then lower to advisory levels tonight through Thursday as this swell slowly eases and shifts out of the north. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 6 to 8 feet along west facing shores. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
